reviews.review_msg: interesting class & deb knows the material. her exams are difficult cuz she tests on anything from the lectures & text -not just the big picture. the tutorials aren't that helpful.
Awesome prof.  I loved the class, though the exams were pretty tough.  She tests from lecture and text - go through everything, not just the grand structure.

While Dr. Connolly thoroughly invests herself in the material and is a very enthusiastic lecturer, her tests cover a ridiculous amount of information, considering that most students take full-course loads.

Such a great professor ... extremely clear and knowledgable about law and psyc. Tests cover A LOT of material, so be aware. I would recommend her though ... she definitely goes the extra mile for her students, which is very helpful, considering none of her TA's cared that much about the class ...

great prof although she speaks a bit fast some times. exams are ok (mc,fill-in-blanks,& short answers), a bit ambiguous. depending on your TA, tutorials do help clarify what they want for the term paper

Great prof! Goes over the material in a clear and enthusiastic way. Interesting subject. Overheads and taped lectures are great. Very positive attitude towards students. Exams are ok. Tutorials are pointless.
this is a good class and connolly is a great prof. what trashes this class is a certain useless TA. ask around you will find out who to avoid.

Nice teacher, interesting material especially if u have taken any crim classes. She does tape her lectures now and overheads are pretty good. Speaks enthusiastically and is very knowledgeable about the material.
She doesn't tape her lectures. She talks fast and her overheads are not very helpful. The short answer on the exams are hard. It seems like a memorization contest.
Great class
dont like how she doesnt tape her lectures and wont even consider doing it. lots of material in lecture and hard to keep up. slides are awful.
Lot
Material interesting. Connelly is not. Unorganized and class was behind schedule
No Comments

Boring prof, More of a lawyer than a psychologist. Needs to upgrade his psyc 100, disagreed with him on lots of things and contricts other sfu professors. Got an A+ in the class but had to yack about B.S that I disagreed with on the paper in order to get this mark.
he's a terrible marker
You know its a bad class when the T.A's are openly discussing how much they can't stand working for him! Enough said.

the 1st half of the course i hated....but towards to then i really enjoyed it....i failed the midterm but still got a B- so.....not too hard...2nd half of the course is easier if you're a psyc major...
No Comments
the midterms are very difficult!

This professor is terrible,  I did well on the mid., but I thought it was difficult.  He is EXTREMELY disorganized, the 2nd midterm was re-scheduled 3 times. Did not know what readings were for 2nd mid. until it was the week before it, and it was not on the syllabus because it was revised 3 times,
I can remember what happened in R. v. Jones:) And of course there's legal material in the course ... it's called Law and Psychology! Awesome course, average instructor.
No Comments
If you take this class take a pillow...Only the Psych department would have a cognitive psychologist teaching a legally based course.
Material is interesting but 830 class is a killing. Exams focus too much on memorization. Who can remember what happened in R. vs. Jones.
